issue.title: Use fetch over XHR
issue.body:
Looking at PWA specs, it seems that XHR's won't be supported. If we want to be to some extent compatible, we should use it by default and fallback when needed. This will only be necessary for search queries.

 - [ ] check the API of fetch and the compatibility with XHR one
 - [ ] implement on search operations

This could be done when making the minimal client (one that has only a few functions for search)

issue.title: Use fetch over XHR
issue.body:
Looking at PWA specs, it seems that XHR's won't be supported. If we want to be to some extent compatible, we should use it by default and fallback when needed. This will only be necessary for search queries.

 - [ ] check the API of fetch and the compatibility with XHR one
 - [ ] implement on search operations

This could be done when making the minimal client (one that has only a few functions for search)

comment.body:
All right, just so you know, you can use the fetch requester without using the REST API like this:

```js
import { createFetchRequester } from '@algolia/requester-fetch'
import algoliasearch from 'algoliasearch'

const client = algoliasearch('', '', { requester: createFetchRequester() })
```

as documented here: https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-client/getting-started/customize/javascript/?client=javascript#changing-http-request-methods

 - [ ] implement on search operations

comment.body: NICE, that what I ended up doing. I just used the REST api. Very cool.

comment.body: Yea this means you cannot use it in a web worker or a cloudflare worker.

issue.title: Package does not seem to exist: npm install algoliasearch-lite
issue.body:
Following the directions in [this documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-client/getting-started/install/javascript/?client=javascript#install-via-npm-recommended) for installing the module, it seems like I should be able to run `npm install algoliasearch-lite`, however when I do the package doesn't seem to exist.  Is there a way to only install the lite version via npm?

```
$ npm install algoliasearch-lite                   
npm ERR! code E404
npm ERR! 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/algoliasearch-lite - Not found
npm ERR! 404 
npm ERR! 404  'algoliasearch-lite@*' is not in this registry.
```

issue.title: Package does not seem to exist: npm install algoliasearch-lite
issue.body:
Following the directions in [this documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-client/getting-started/install/javascript/?client=javascript#install-via-npm-recommended) for installing the module, it seems like I should be able to run `npm install algoliasearch-lite`, however when I do the package doesn't seem to exist.  Is there a way to only install the lite version via npm?

```
$ npm install algoliasearch-lite                   
npm ERR! code E404
npm ERR! 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/algoliasearch-lite - Not found
npm ERR! 404 
npm ERR! 404  'algoliasearch-lite@*' is not in this registry.
```

comment.body: Gotcha, thanks for the quick response!

issue.title: Package does not seem to exist: npm install algoliasearch-lite
issue.body:
Following the directions in [this documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-client/getting-started/install/javascript/?client=javascript#install-via-npm-recommended) for installing the module, it seems like I should be able to run `npm install algoliasearch-lite`, however when I do the package doesn't seem to exist.  Is there a way to only install the lite version via npm?

```
$ npm install algoliasearch-lite                   
npm ERR! code E404
npm ERR! 404 Not Found - GET https://registry.npmjs.org/algoliasearch-lite - Not found
npm ERR! 404 
npm ERR! 404  'algoliasearch-lite@*' is not in this registry.
```

comment.body: > Hey, the `lite` package is not a standalone package but part of `algoliasearch`, you can do `npm install algoliasearch` and then `import * from 'algoliasearch/lite'`

issue.title: Package does not seem to exist: npm install algoliasearch-lite
issue.body:
Following the directions in [this documentation](https://www.algolia.com/doc/api-client/getting-started/install/javascript/?client=javascript#install-via-npm-recommended) for installing the module, it seems like I should be able to run `npm install algoliasearch-lite`, however when I do the package doesn't seem to exist.  Is there a way to only install the lite version via npm?

```
$ npm install algoliasearch-lite                   
npm ERR! code E404

```

comment.body: Hey, the `lite` package is not a standalone package but part of `algoliasearch`, you can do `npm install algoliasearch` and then `import 'algoliasearch/lite`

issue.title: Use fetch over XHR
issue.body:
Looking at PWA specs, it seems that XHR's won't be supported. If we want to be to some extent compatible, we should use it by default and fallback when needed. This will only be necessary for search queries.

 - [ ] check the API of fetch and the compatibility with XHR one
 - [ ] implement on search operations

This could be done when making the minimal client (one that has only a few functions for search)

comment.body:
We have a fetch requester available now as well @richtera: https://github.com/algolia/algoliasearch-client-javascript/tree/master/packages/requester-fetch

the reason we stayed with xhr is that there's still a decent amount of supported platforms at the time of release of v4 that wouldn't work with only fetch
